intro: Uvaria sorzogonensis, commonly known as the Mindanao hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a smooth or slightly serrated edge. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
